person.persName: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand

div1.p: United States of America, ss:
The President of the United States of America,
To the Honorable the Judges of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Division.
Greeting:

Whereas, lately in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Division, before you, or some of you, in a cause between entitled In the Matter of the Application of James P. Lavin and SISTER SUPERIOR M. ANGELIQUE, for a Writ of Certiorari an order or judgment of remand was duly filed on the 19th day of February, 1903, remanding the petitioners to the custody of James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector, etc., and in the Matter of the Application of YVONNE LE FEVRE, GEORGETTE NORMAND, and MARIE LE FEVRE for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, an order or judgment was duly filed on the 5th day of March. 1903, denying the petition for a rehearing and for the modification of the said order ir judgment entered on the 19th day of February, 1904, and directing the said Immigrant Inspector to carry into effect the said last mentioned order or judgment etc,: which said orderd or judgments are of record in the said matters in the office of the clerk of the said Circuit Court; (to which record refrence is hereby made and the same is hereby expressly made a part hereof,)
as by the inspection of the trascript of the record of the said Circuit Court, which was brought into the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit by virtue of an appeal greeably to the act of Congress in such cases made and provided, fully and at large appears:

And whereas, on the 6th day of May in the year of our Lord one thousand, nine hundred and three, the said cause came on to be heard before the said Circuit Court of Appeals, on the said trascript of record, and was argued by counsel:

as by the inspection of the trascript of the record of the said Circuit Court, which was brought into the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the ninth Circuit by virtue of an appeal agreeably to the act of Congress in such cases made and provided, fully and at large appears:

And whereas, on the 6th day of May in the year of our Lord one thousand, nine hundred and three, the said cause came on the heard before the said Circuit Court of Appeals, on the said transcript of record, and was argued by counsel:

On consideration whereof, It is now here ordered and adjudged by this Court, that the judgment of the said Circuit Court in this cause be, and the same is hereby, modified, with instructions to vacate its order of deportation, discharge the writ of habeas corpus, and remand the appelles to the custody of the Immigrant Inspector. (Nov. 2, 1903)

You, therefore, are hereby commanded that such modification etc., and further proceedings be had in said cause, in accordance with the opinion and judgment of this Court and as according to right and justice and the laws if the United States ought to be had, the said orders of judgments of said Circuit Court notwithstanding.
Witness, the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER, Chief Justice of the United Sttes, the 4th day of December, in the year of our Lord one thousand, nine hundred and three.
COST OF Transcript, paid Clerk below, $ Clerk U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals, $ Printing Record, $ Attorney's Docket Fee, $ Taxed at $
Clerk,
F.D. Monekton, Clerk of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.
GOB 7-58V
UNITED STATES Circuit Court of Appeals For the Ninth Circuit.
James P. Lavin et al. vs. Yuome Le Fevre et al.
MANDATE.
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON JAN 7 1904 A.REEVES AYRES, Clerk HMSStatiherd Deputy
